description.b: Use the Maturity Assessment Tool (MAT) to analyze the application to be migrated in order to characterize the business situation of the current legacy application as well as the characteristics that the migrated application should have under the business perspective.

item.title: Open MAT in a web browser

description.b: Login into MAT by providing a valid login and password combination and pressing the “Accept” button. If you don't have an account, click on the “Create New User” button to create one. In this window the user has to fill in the formulary and press the “Create User” button. The fields with and (*) are mandatory.

item.title: Select dimension and scope of the questionnaire

description.b: In the dimension selection page that appears after login, select a dimension from the available ones (business, process, and technical) and the scope of the questionnaire (current situation, future situation)

Once the dimension and the scope are selected, the category window is opened. In this window you can view all the categories to be evaluated for a certain dimension/scope. Here the current status of the score achieved (based on the current status of the questionnaire that is the answers already provided) and the maximum score for each of the areas inside a dimension are presented. Also, the total score per dimension is showed.

Clicking in any category will allow you to access the Question window, where you need to answer the relevant questionnaire. Clicking on “Save Answers” button will store your answers, so when you enter the questionnaire again, the questions will be answered. If the “Cancel” button is clicked, the previous windows will appear without saving changes.
You can check the results of the questionnaire in the different dimension tabs. You can also see graphical charts by clicking in the buttons of each category/dimesion.

You need to answer the relevant questionnaire. Clicking on “Save Answers” button will store your answers, so when you enter the questionnaire again, the questions will be answered. If the “Cancel” button is clicked, the previous windows will appear without saving changes.
Click the "Generate Report" button. A new window(tab) will be opened into your web browser showing the MAT report pdf file.
Click the "Generate Files" button. In this section two files can be generated. MPT XML file for feeding the MPT tool and GML file to feed the Migration Goal Editor tool
Download MAT MPT report in order to use it for configuring the methodology.
